name: Purged k-fold cross-validation script
description:
The objective of this script is performing a purged k-fold cross validation of any supervised model built from a time-series like already sorted dataset. The algorithm:

 - Divides the dataset in k parts
 - Holds out the data in one of the parts and builds a supervised model
 with the rest of data
 - Removes the edges of the hold out dataset to create the test dataset (avoiding leakage).
- Evaluates the supervised model with the purged test dataset
 - The second, third and fourth steps are repeated with each of the k parts, so that
 k evaluations are generated
 - Finally, the evaluation metrics are averaged to provide the cross-validation
 metrics.

 The **goal** of the script is producing a
 cross-validation, an evaluation whose metrics are averages of the k evaluations
 created in the cross-validation process.

 For more information, please see the [readme](https://github.com/whizzml/examples/tree/master/cross-validation/purged-cross-validation).
